snippet: The attack was a further blow to the three-day polio vaccination drive, which had already been stymied in some parts of the country by Taliban threats.
abstract: Gunmen open fire on a United Nations vehicle in the southern port city of Karachi, seriously wounding a Ghanaian doctor who was part of an urgent campaign to eradicate polio from Pakistan; attack is a further blow to the three-day polio vaccination drive, which has already been stymied in some parts of the country by Taliban threats.
lead_paragraph: The attack was a further blow to the three-day polio vaccination drive, which had already been stymied in some parts of the country by Taliban threats.

headline.seo: Gunmen Wound U.N. Polio Doctor in Pakistan
headline.main: Gunmen Attack U.N. Vehicle in Pakistan, Wounding Polio Doctor
headline.print_headline: Gunmen Attack U.N. Vehicle in Pakistan, Wounding Polio Doctor
